riskFactors.description: Pioneering use of virtual cameras, performance capture volumes, and 3D stereoscopic rigs creates unprecedented risk of failure, delays, and cost overruns.
Production in remote New Zealand locations presents challenges including weather dependency, equipment transport, and medical evacuation logistics.
Extensive aerial sequences, high-altitude set construction (Hometree), and intensive performance capture work elevate the risk of accidents and injuries.
The exceptionally large budget increases the financial impact of any potential delay or incident.

recommendations.recommendation: Implement triple-redundancy for all critical data and backup systems for virtual cameras and capture volumes. Conduct extensive pre-production testing.
Employ specialized safety coordinators for all high-risk activities (height, aerial, stunts). Maintain a robust on-set medical presence with a clear emergency evacuation plan for remote locations.
Build significant weather contingency days into the New Zealand schedule. Utilize currency hedging contracts to mitigate NZD/USD fluctuation risk.
Ensure mandatory rest periods and physical conditioning programs for all performers involved in long-duration performance capture to mitigate risk of repetitive strain injuries.
